parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 2.02

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value>  local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value>  global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Scales an [[attachTo|attached object]] or a [[Arma_3_Simple_Objects|Simple Object]]'s model.

</value></part><part><name>pr</name>=<value> The <template><title>arma3</title></template> [[LOD]] limits still apply, meaning walk-able surfaces can only be X m in size, and collision in general will only work up to X m from object center.
This command works on all objects in [[Eden Editor]] or scenario preview, but it will not save and will reset when objects get moved. [[Eden Editor]] support is only intended for artists.
Setting the scale of actively simulated objects (Vehicles with players/AI in them) is possible, but not officially supported, you may encounter issues.

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> object [[setObjectScale]] scale

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] - Must be either an [[attachTo|attached object]] or [[Arma 3 Simple Objects|Simple Object]]</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> scale: [[Number]] - Limited to 0.0001 to 65504, relative to the object model's normal scale

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_mrap [[attachTo]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[player]],[0,0,0]];
_mrap [[setObjectScale]] 0.1;</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code><template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Select an object in [[Eden Editor]] and execute the following code in the [[Arma 3: Debug Console]]. When moving the object, the effect is reset!</value></part></template>
([[get3DENSelected]] "Object" # 0) [[setObjectScale]] 0.1;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[getObjectScale]]
</value></part></template></root>
